definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~

sentences.english: The core of language quality is language sense.
sentences.chinese: 语文素质的核心是语感。

sentences.english: The teaching principle is Student-centered, with meticulous teaching and lots of practice to train the students master the sense of language. I…
sentences.chinese: 其教学原则是，以学生为中心，强化语感，精讲多练。

sentences.english: By the same token, achieved certain amount, "language sense" is created.
sentences.chinese: 同样的道理，达到了一定的量，“语感”就产生了。

sentences.english: Try to read a short English passage every day to build up your language sense.
sentences.chinese: 每天读一段英语短文来培养语感。

sentences.english: Explanation for you, the language sense is the highest state of learning English well.
sentences.chinese: 需要说明的是，语感是学好英语的最高境界。

sentences.english: Fuzzy Theory threshold in the sense of language teaching with intuitive, holistic and Implication of characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 模糊理论视阈内的语感教学的过程。

sentences.english: and kind of the way that it does function.
One of the most effective ways to develop language intuition is reading.
sentences.chinese: 阅读是培养语感的有效途径之一。

definition: to pronounce a word after mentally processing its spelling/(phonics) blending
(of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
